channel.title: Items Needing Requirments
channel.description: Ok well over my 1-2 months of coding,i've become a pretty decent coder...i've beening adding,removing,and fixing things on my server,and LEARNING ALOT from reading tut's and figuring things out on my own,i just recently took notice to some items on my server,people can wear like fighter torsos,rune defenders ect..without the stats to wear them...probably a REALLY stupid question to be asking but,i was wondering if anyone could tell me how to change/add stat requirments for items,any help would be greatly appericated. :rolleyes:

item.title: Items Needing Requirments
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

U can also use the item id
E.g

if (itemID == itemid)
return #;

Read full topic

item.title: Items Needing Requirments
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

Yes… yes it could be - Point asside I recommend those who are getting hard over claiming what source they are using etc… should put that time to use and actually provide help for whatever this person is using? claiming what source it is or whether its 508+ or not isnt exactly helping. Either way if they were to do some searching they could easily find it as I had done in a mere 2 minutes or so.

Read full topic

item.title: Items Needing Requirments
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

hey guys, personally I havent had a problem with the item levels in my server so I havent encountered this hurdle… but I spose ive always had a curiosity about it… well I did some searches. The following is what I found:

Well in Wearing.java there are many cases of the following (with different items)

if (ItemName.startsWith("Bronze")) { return 1; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Iron")) { return 1; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Steel")) { return 5; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Black")) { return 10; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Mithril")) { return 20; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Adamant")) { return 30; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Rune")) { return 40; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Dragon")) { return 60; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("White")) { return 70; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Steel defender")) { return 5; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Black defender")) { return 10; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Mithril defender")) { return 20; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Adamant defender")) { return 30; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Rune defender")) { return 40;
Well I havent really run any tests on this.. but considering the in-game item levels correspond to the levels displayed here e.g
return 40;
This being Rune, which of course requires 40 defense... Now just go look through the Wearing.java and see if you can find some of the items you want to change the level of.. and change the "Return #;" and see.. Of course with testing, make a backup of the file.. but yes, see if this works and apologies if it doesnt.. as I said, im no expert in these ground as I havent had a problem with the origional item level requirements.
public int GetCLStrength(int ItemID) { if (ItemID == -1) { return 1; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Strength hood")) { return 99; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Strength cape")) { return 99; } return 1; }

[This may also prove helpful in explanation, or if you wanted to add another skill to the requirements list, maybe using this as a template to help (depending on the source)]

-Hawk

Read full topic
